daily_fact: Despite the decline of the Pumpernickel Bagel, New York City bagel shops are innovating with new flavors and combinations, ensuring that this beloved staple continues to evolve and delight locals.
topline_md: A two-alarm house fire in the Bronx injured four individuals, while Brooklyn residents have been without heat for weeks; NYC's alternate side parking is suspended due to a snowstorm, and Mayor Mamdani faces challenges with a housing bill and a $12B budget deficit.

risks_alerts.title: Risks & Alerts
risks_alerts.summary_md:
### Risks & Alerts

- Two firefighters and two residents injured in a two-alarm house fire in the Bronx. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Residents at 2342 Atlantic Avenue in Bronxville report being without heat for weeks. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Alternate side parking in NYC suspended through February 1 due to snowstorm. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Commuter ferry service to NYC disrupted due to frigid conditions causing ice on the Hudson River. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Travel around NYC remains uneven following the recent winter storm. ### Civics & Politics

- NYC Mayor Mamdani to propose tax hike due to a $12B budget deficit from the previous administration. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Mayor Mamdani-backed housing bill fails in City Council, impacting affordable housing initiatives. - PopUp Bagels will open on February 6, offering a new dining option in the area.
